required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose Finding Study of HP802-247 in Venous Leg Ulcers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled Dose Finding Study Investigating the Efficacy of HP802-247 in Venous Leg Ulcers

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 16-week study for subjects with a venous leg ulcer between the knee and ankle. This research is being done to determine the effectiveness of two dosing frequencies and two different concentrations of HP802-247, together with standard care, compared to placebo, plus standard care.

primary_outcome.measure: The Average Percent (%) Change From Baseline in the Target Wound Area in Each Treatment Group Over the Twelve-week Double-blind Treatment Period.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly, over the 12 week treatment period, or until wound closure, which ever occurred first
primary_outcome.description: For each treatment group the area of each subject's target ulcer was measured on a weekly basis, for up to 12 weeks, or until wound closure, whichever occurred first, using a laser-based wound imaging system in conjunction with software to measure area. An average of the 12 measurements were assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14 weeks - the final visit for one subject was delayed by two weeks
secondary_outcome.description: This key secondary outcome was the days to wound closure based on a Kaplan-Meier survival analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Change From Baseline in Target Wound Area at Each of the Twelve Double-blind Treatment Weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly, over the 12 week treatment period, or until wound closure, which ever occurred first
secondary_outcome.description: For each treatment group the area of each subject's target ulcer was measured on a weekly basis, for up to 12 weeks, using a laser-based wound imaging system in conjunction with software to measure area.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Achieving ≥ 50% Decrease in Target Wound Area From Baseline Through Week 13
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over the 12 week treatment period or until the wound closed, which ever occurred first.
secondary_outcome.description: The area of each subject's target wound was measured at each visit and the proportion of subjects with a decrease in area from baseline ≥ 50% was calculated for each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Wound Closure at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly, over the 12 week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment groups were compared for the proportion of wounds closed at each weekly visit. For subjects who dropped from the study, their remaining visit values were imputed using LOCF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Target Ulcer Pain Was Measured Using a Visual Analog Scale [Range: 0mm - 100mm]. Subjects Marked Their Pain Level on a 100 mm Horizontal Line, With a Short Vertical Line Across the Scale, 0 Denoting no Pain and 100mm the Maximum Pain.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly, over the 12 week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Target ulcer pain was measured using a Visual Analog Scale [Range: 0mm - 100mm]. Subjects marked their pain level on a 100 mm horizontal line, with a short vertical line across the scale, 0 denoting no pain and 100mm the maximum pain. Each weekly measurement is reported as the average of all subjects scores at each week per treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to Achieve Complete Wound Closure, Based on Based on a Kaplan-Meier Survival Analysis, Over the 12-Week Treatment Period From Baseline.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14 weeks - the final visit for one subject was delayed by two weeks
secondary_outcome.description: This key secondary outcome was the days to wound closure based on a Kaplan-Meier survival analysis.

arm_group.description: Low dose HP802-247, applied at each visit
Low dose HP802-247 applied at Visits 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11 and Placebo at Visits 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12
High dose HP802-247, applied at each visit
High dose HP802-247, applied at Visits 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11 and Placebo at Visits 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12

intervention.description: One dose of HP802-247 consists of 260 microliters (uL) containing keratinocytes and fibroblasts totaling 0.5 x 10-6 power or 5.0 x 10-6 power cells per mL, plus fibrin.
Placebo (Vehicle) consisting of: Component 1 - acellular fibrinogen solution; Component 2 - acellular thrombin solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provide informed consent.
- Willing to comply with protocol instructions, including allowing all study assessments.
- Have a venous leg ulcer (venous etiology)between the knee and ankle, at or above the malleolus.
- Venous insufficiency confirmed by duplex Doppler ultrasound examination for valvular or venous incompetence.
- Target ulcer duration greater than or equal to 6 weeks but less than or equal to 24 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant or lactating
- Therapy with another investigational agent within thirty (30) days of Screening, or during the study.
- A target ulcer of non-venous etiologies.
- Refusal of or inability to tolerate compression therapy.
- Therapy of the target ulcer with tissue-engineered cell-based skin equivalents within 30 days preceding the Screening Visit.
- Therapy of the target ulcer with topical growth factors within 1 week preceding the Screening Visit.

facility.name: University of AZ College of Medicine
UCSD Wound Treatment and Research Center
Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine
Dixie Regional Medical Center's Wound Clinic
Providence Sacred Heart Medical Center Wound Clinic
Aging Rehabilitation & Geriatric Care Research Center

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were screened at 34 sites in the US and one in Canada, between June 11, 2009 and May 5, 2011; sites included independent and hospital wound clinics and private practice sites.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects entered a 2-week run-in; subjects whose wound radius decreased by < 0.349 cm/2weeks and met all other inclusion/exclusion (I/E) criteria were eligible for randomization.

group.description: Low dose HP802-247 applied at Visits 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11 and Placebo at Visits 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 HP802-247: One dose of HP802-247 consists of 260 microliters (uL) containing keratinocytes and fibroblasts totaling 0.5 x 10-6 power or 5.0 x 10-6 power cells per mL, plus fibrin.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: The Average Percent (%) Change From Baseline in the Target Wound Area in Each Treatment Group Over the Twelve-week Double-blind Treatment Period.
outcome.description: For each treatment group the area of each subject’s target ulcer was measured on a weekly basis, for up to 12 weeks, or until wound closure, whichever occurred first, using a laser-based wound imaging system in conjunction with software to measure area. An average of the 12 measurements were assessed.
outcome.time_frame: Weekly, over the 12 week treatment period, or until wound closure, which ever occurred first
outcome.population: ITT population.: Subjects who received at least one dose of test article. The primary analysis was performed using a two-way ANCOVA model, which included treatment group (the effect of interest), site, and the baseline target wound area (the covariate), with significance being at P < 0.05.

outcome.title: Percent of Change From Baseline in Target Wound Area at Each of the Twelve Double-blind Treatment Weeks.
outcome.description: For each treatment group the area of each subject’s target ulcer was measured on a weekly basis, for up to 12 weeks, using a laser-based wound imaging system in conjunction with software to measure area.
outcome.time_frame: Weekly, over the 12 week treatment period, or until wound closure, which ever occurred first
outcome.population: ITT population. Subjects who received at least one dose of test article. The data at each week were analyzed using a two-way ANCOVA model, which included treatment group (the effect of interest), site, and the baseline target wound area (the covariate). Significance was attained at P < 0.05.

measure.title: Percent of Change From Baseline in Target Wound Area at Each of the Twelve Double-blind Treatment Weeks.
measure.description: For each treatment group the area of each subject’s target ulcer was measured on a weekly basis, for up to 12 weeks, using a laser-based wound imaging system in conjunction with software to measure area.
measure.population: ITT population. Subjects who received at least one dose of test article. The data at each week were analyzed using a two-way ANCOVA model, which included treatment group (the effect of interest), site, and the baseline target wound area (the covariate). Significance was attained at P < 0.05.

outcome.title: Proportion of Subjects Achieving ≥ 50% Decrease in Target Wound Area From Baseline Through Week 13
outcome.description: The area of each subject’s target wound was measured at each visit and the proportion of subjects with a decrease in area from baseline ≥ 50% was calculated for each treatment group.
outcome.time_frame: Over the 12 week treatment period or until the wound closed, which ever occurred first.
outcome.population: The non-parametric Cochrane Mantel Haenszel test with adjustment for pooled site was used to examine treatment effects at each time point on the proportion of responders who have an average of ≥50% reduction from baseline in wound area over the treatment period. The test was performed separately for each pair of an active treatment vs. placebo.

measure.title: Proportion of Subjects Achieving ≥ 50% Decrease in Target Wound Area From Baseline Through Week 13
measure.description: The area of each subject’s target wound was measured at each visit and the proportion of subjects with a decrease in area from baseline ≥ 50% was calculated for each treatment group.
measure.population: The non-parametric Cochrane Mantel Haenszel test with adjustment for pooled site was used to examine treatment effects at each time point on the proportion of responders who have an average of ≥50% reduction from baseline in wound area over the treatment period. The test was performed separately for each pair of an active treatment vs. placebo.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Wound Closure at Each Visit
outcome.description: Treatment groups were compared for the proportion of wounds closed at each weekly visit. For subjects who dropped from the study, their remaining visit values were imputed using LOCF.
outcome.time_frame: Weekly, over the 12 week treatment period
outcome.population: ITT Populations: Subjects who received at least one dose of test article. Analysis was by the Cochrane Mantel Haenszel (CMH) test

outcome.title: Target Ulcer Pain Was Measured Using a Visual Analog Scale [Range: 0mm – 100mm]. Subjects Marked Their Pain Level on a 100 mm Horizontal Line, With a Short Vertical Line Across the Scale, 0 Denoting no Pain and 100mm the Maximum Pain.
outcome.description: Target ulcer pain was measured using a Visual Analog Scale [Range: 0mm – 100mm]. Subjects marked their pain level on a 100 mm horizontal line, with a short vertical line across the scale, 0 denoting no pain and 100mm the maximum pain. Each weekly measurement is reported as the average of all subjects scores at each week per treatment group.

reported_events.time_frame: The duration of the 12-week treatment period
reported_events.desc: All subjects randomized to treatment were questioned about adverse events and were included in the number of participants assessed for safety. The first assessments at each weekly visit were about changes in general health and concomitant medications and the occurrence of adverse events.

group.description: Low dose HP802-247, applied at each visit HP802-247: One dose of HP802-247 consists of 260 microliters (uL) containing keratinocytes and fibroblasts totaling 0.5 x 10-6 power or 5.0 x 10-6 power cells per mL, plus fibrin.

group.title: D - High Q14D
group.description: High dose HP802-247, applied at Visits 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11 and Placebo at Visits 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 HP802-247: One dose of HP802-247 consists of 260 microliters (uL) containing keratinocytes and fibroblasts totaling 0.5 x 10-6 power or 5.0 x 10-6 power cells per mL, plus fibrin.

group.title: C - High Q7D
group.description: High dose HP802-247, applied at each visit HP802-247: One dose of HP802-247 consists of 260 microliters (uL) containing keratinocytes and fibroblasts totaling 0.5 x 10-6 power or 5.0 x 10-6 power cells per mL, plus fibrin.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: General disorders and administration site conditions

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
